description:
This emoji means “full” in Japanese, usually used to denote “full capacity” such as a gas/petrol tank on a car or pre-paid phone card.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.
apple_vendor_description: The Japanese 'No Vacancy' button emoji on Apple devices is a vibrant red circle with bold, white Japanese characters conveying its meaning.  Apple's signature glossy 3D shading gives this button a polished, almost tangible appearance, suggesting a sense of urgency or clear availability status. Its smooth gradients and realistic lighting make it stand out, perfect for conveying a definitive 'yes' or 'no' in a visually striking way.
